trans-unit.source: There are two general (supported) ways to start and run the script:
trans-unit.target: 有两种一般的(支持的)方式来启动和运行脚本。

trans-unit.source: This all is usually easy to do with “alsamixer” tool.
trans-unit.target: This all is usually easy to do with “alsamixer” tool.

trans-unit.source: This is a regular package for Python 2.7 (not 3.X), but with some extra run-time requirements (see below), which can’t be installed from PyPI.
trans-unit.target: This is a regular package for Python 2.7 (not 3.X), but with some extra run-time requirements (see below), which can’t be installed from PyPI.

trans-unit.source: This method should be preferred, as it correctly notifies init when service is actually ready (i.e. pjsua inputs/outputs initialized), so that others can be scheduled around that, and primes watchdog timer, detecting if/when app might hang due to some bug.
trans-unit.target: 这个方法应该是首选,因为当服务真正准备好的时候,它会正确地通知init(即pjsua输入/输出初始化),这样其他的服务就可以围绕着它进行调度,并启动看门狗定时器,检测应用程序是否会因为某些bug而挂起。

trans-unit.source: This setup assumes you have PJSUA installed, if not, go back to Installation earlier in this readme and install it.
trans-unit.target: 这个设置假设你已经安装了PJSUA,如果没有,请回到本readme前面的Installation并安装它。

trans-unit.source: This should print a potentially-long list of “playback devices” (PJSUA terminology) that can be used for output there, as shown above.
trans-unit.target: This should print a potentially-long list of “playback devices” (PJSUA terminology) that can be used for output there, as shown above.

trans-unit.source: To avoid having any confusing non-ALSA (incl. pulse-alsa emulation) ports there, PortAudio can be compiled with only ALSA as a backend.
trans-unit.target: 为了避免任何非 ALSA (包括脉冲-alsa 仿真)端口的混淆,PortAudio 可以只用 ALSA 作为后端进行编译。

trans-unit.target: To benchmark, you’ll need to set up callram.py.

trans-unit.source: User=paging
trans-unit.target: User=paging

trans-unit.source: Usually when pulse is installed, “pulse” ALSA output gets configured, and that is what script uses by default, so no addition configuration should be necessary in that case.
trans-unit.target: Usually when pulse is installed, “pulse” ALSA output gets configured, and that is what script uses by default, so no addition configuration should be necessary in that case.

trans-unit.source: We’ve tested this script with thousands of calls, it is fairly reliable and light on resources. Total CPU use on a Pentium 4 @ 2.8ghz hovered around 0.5% with 4MB ram usage. identical figures were observed on a Celeron D @ 2.53Ghz, you could probably get away with whatever your operating system requires to run in terms of hardware.
trans-unit.target: We’ve tested this script with thousands of calls, it is fairly reliable and light on resources. Total CPU use on a Pentium 4 @ 2.8ghz hovered around 0.5% with 4MB ram usage. identical figures were observed on a Celeron D @ 2.53Ghz, you could probably get away with whatever your operating system requires to run in terms of hardware.
